title: 254. What Are Gender Barriers Made Of?
description: Overt discrimination in the labor markets may be on the wane, but women are still subtly penalized by all sorts of societal conventions. How can those penalties be removed without burning down the house?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: Overt discrimination in the labor markets may be on the wane, but women are still subtly penalized by all sorts of societal conventions. How can those penalties be removed without burning down the house?
